001package imagingbook.common.color.gamma;
002
003/**
004 * <p>
005 * Defines the basic "gamma correction" used for converting linear to
006 * non-linear color component values. The mapping function consists of a 
007 * non-linear part only. Note that {@code gamma} specifies the nominal &gamma;
008 * parameter for the <em>forward</em> (i.e., linear to non-linear) mapping, e.g.,
009 * &gamma; ~ 1/2.2 for Adobe RGB. See Sec. 3.7.2 of [1] for more details.
010 * </p>
011 * <p>
012 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
013 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
014 * </p>
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2022/11/14
018 */
019public class SimpleGammaMapping implements GammaMapping {
020        
021        private final double gamma;
022        private final double igamma;
023        
024        public SimpleGammaMapping(double gamma) {
025                this.gamma = gamma;
026                this.igamma = 1.0 / gamma;
027        }
028
029        @Override
030        public double applyFwd(double a) {
031                return Math.pow(a, gamma);
032        }
033
034        @Override
035        public double applyInv(double b) {
036                return Math.pow(b, igamma);
037        }
038
039}
